intro: Chupalon formosum, commonly known as the Formosan chupalon, is a rare and unique plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often variegated with white and green patterns. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically followed by bright red berries. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
